column2: What does Recovery Time Objective (RTO) specify?

column3: The maximum acceptable data loss measured in time
column5: Incorrect. This describes RPO.

column3: The maximum acceptable time between function disruption and restoration
column5: Correct! This is the definition of RTO.

column3: The time needed to create a backup
column5: Incorrect. This is backup window planning.

column3: The time between security incidents
column5: Incorrect. This is unrelated to RTO.

column2: Think about what "time" objective RTO refers to
RTO specifies the maximum acceptable time between function disruption and restoration
Which statements accurately describe Recovery Point Objective (RPO)? (Select all that apply)

column3: It specifies the maximum acceptable data loss measured in time
column5: Correct. This is the key definition.

column3: It represents how much data recreation or reentry the organization can tolerate
column5: Correct. This explains the practical implication.

column3: It directly influences backup frequency for transaction-processing systems
column5: Correct. More frequent backups are needed for shorter RPOs.

column3: It measures how quickly a function must be restored
column5: Incorrect. This describes RTO

column3: It determines the color scheme for backup media
column5: Incorrect. This is unrelated to RPO.

column2: Think about what "point" in time RPO refers to
RPO specifies maximum acceptable data loss measured in time and directly influences backup frequency
